# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

```julia
function wrap_string(input_str, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = split(input_str, r"\s+"))
    
    wrapped_lines = []
    for line in lines
        if length(line) > text_width
            push!(wrapped_lines, line[1:text_width]) 
            push!(wrapped_lines, "\n") # Add a new line
            line = line[text_width+1:end]
        end
        push!(wrapped_lines, line))
    end
    
    return join(wrapped_lines)
end

# Example usage
input_str = "This is a very long sentence that needs to be wrapped within a text width of 10 characters or less. Let's see how the function handles it."
wrapped_string = wrap_string(input_str, text_width=10))
println(wrapped_string)
```

sentence that needs to be
